info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rutherford, southeastern Polk, southwestern Cleveland, northwestern Spartanburg and northwestern Cherokee Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Columbus to 8 miles southeast of Forest City. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chesnee, Campobello, Cowpens National Battlefield, Lake Bowen, Boiling Springs NC, Mooresboro, Landrum, Cliffside, Henrietta and Harris. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
